result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony J. Harried was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Activity:Plea and sentencing 
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

10:29 AM Defendant Anthony J. Harried in court in person with attorney Kelly James Mattingly in person.  Mary Elizabeth Bricco appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. Count 1 dismissed and read in. Count 2 defendant pleads no contest. Court finds defendant guilty. Court orders 18 months probation, costs due within 60 days, DVIP, AODA and any other treatment deemed necessary. Sentence credit 45 days.
